TEXT.S:
balakas
siwkay nu balakas u balakas sa, musakamu ku taw, patawa tu zuma a tademaw. u ngangan nu tademaw u ngangan nu wawama nu Bayu' Dietu-Kabit.
tinaku a kamu balakasen (/ balakasen ni Abu ku wacu ni Benel! mababalakas / mababalakas kiza adiwawa i kakabi'an. mabalakas / mabalakas kiza tademaw sa. mabalakasay / mabalakasay ci Pelac i niyazu' nu Maibul. mibalakas ; / mibalakas ku wacu tu nani'. pibalakas ; / amana pibalakas i zazan! pibalakasi / pibalakasi kisu tu mali i putah! sapibalakas / u culen ku sapibalakas nu wawa i putah.
u sulit nu Hulam atu Amilika :Humour Humor"humour" Humour (British English) or humor (American English; see spelling differences) is the tendency of particular cognitive experiences to provoke laughter and provide amusement. The term derives from the humoral medicine of the ancient Greeks, which taught that the balance of fluids in the human body, known as humours (Latin: humor, "body fluid"), controlled human health and emotion.
